ðŸš€ ComfyUI-Video-Stabilizer | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Stabilizing video footage within ComfyUI workflows, particularly for AI-generated or manipulated video content, with options for handling edge artifacts and integration with outpainting tools.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Video stabilization using classic feature points and Lucas-Kanade (LK) optical flow. â€¢ Video stabilization using DIS Optical Flow.
ðŸ“– Summary: The ComfyUI Video Stabilizer is a custom node for ComfyUI that stabilizes video footage using either classic feature point tracking or optical flow methods. It offers various framing modes to handle stabilization-induced edge artifacts, including cropping, padding, and expanding the canvas, with padding output as a mask for further processing like outpainting.

âœ¨ Shiru | Svelte
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Managing and streaming personal media library.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Anime integration with AniList & MyAnimeList â€¢ Full subtitle support (softcoded and external files) â€¢ Seamless video controls and keyboard shortcuts â€¢ Real-time library playback â€¢ Dub & Sub Notifications
ðŸ“– Summary: Shiru is a personal media library manager that allows users to organize, track, and stream their legally owned media content in real time. It offers features like anime integration with AniList & MyAnimeList, full subtitle support, seamless video controls, and real-time library playback.

ðŸ”¥ kkTerminal | Vue
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Providing a web-based terminal interface for SSH connections to remote servers.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Web SSH connection â€¢ iframe integration â€¢ Customizable terminal configuration â€¢ Internationalization (Chinese and English) â€¢ Local PC deployment
ðŸ“– Summary: kkTerminal is a web-based SSH client that allows users to access and manage remote servers through a terminal interface in their browser. It supports features like file management, customizable settings, and integration into third-party websites via iframe.

ðŸ’¡ KubeForge | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Visually building, validating, and managing Kubernetes deployment configurations.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Drag-and-drop interface for Kubernetes objects â€¢ Smart schema awareness powered by Kubernetes JSON schemas â€¢ Modular component editor with support for templates and reusable specs â€¢ Real-time visual updates and dependency linking between resources
ðŸ“– Summary: KubeForge is a visual editor for Kubernetes deployments that simplifies building, validating, and managing Kubernetes configurations. It provides an intuitive drag-and-drop interface with live schema references to streamline the creation of valid deployment YAML files, targeting both beginners and experienced users.
